Try executing this chunk by clicking the *Run* button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing *Ctrl+Shift+Enter*. 

```{r}

library(tidyverse)

ld1 <- read.csv("C:\\Users\\dange\\Documents\\ml_mini_project\\datasets_csv\\processed_1\\lockdown1.csv")
ld2 <- read.csv("C:\\Users\\dange\\Documents\\ml_mini_project\\datasets_csv\\processed_1\\lockdown2.csv")
ld3 <- read.csv("C:\\Users\\dange\\Documents\\ml_mini_project\\datasets_csv\\processed_1\\lockdown3.csv")
ld4 <- read.csv("C:\\Users\\dange\\Documents\\ml_mini_project\\datasets_csv\\processed_1\\lockdown4.csv")

ld1['lockdown'] <- "1.0"
ld2['lockdown'] <- "2.0"
ld3['lockdown'] <- "3.0"
ld4['lockdown'] <- "4.0"

ld1 <- drop_na(ld1)
ld2 <- drop_na(ld2)
ld3 <- drop_na(ld3)
ld4 <- drop_na(ld4)

ld1$time <- as.POSIXct(ld1$time, format="%a %b %d %H:%M:%S +0000 %Y")
ld2$time <- as.POSIXct(ld2$time, format="%a %b %d %H:%M:%S +0000 %Y")
ld3$time <- as.POSIXct(ld3$time, format="%a %b %d %H:%M:%S +0000 %Y")
ld4$time <- as.POSIXct(ld4$time, format="%a %b %d %H:%M:%S +0000 %Y")

```


```{r}
library(ggplot2)

data1 <- as.data.frame(cbind(time = ld1$time, sentiment_score = ld1$sentiment_score))
ggplot(data=data1, aes(x=time, y=sentiment_score)) + geom_line()

data2 <- as.data.frame(cbind(time = ld2$time, sentiment_score = ld2$sentiment_score))
ggplot(data=data2, aes(x=time, y=sentiment_score)) + geom_line()

data3 <- as.data.frame(cbind(time = ld3$time, sentiment_score = ld3$sentiment_score))
ggplot(data=data3, aes(x=time, y=sentiment_score)) + geom_line()

data4 <- as.data.frame(cbind(time = ld4$time, sentiment_score = ld4$sentiment_score))
```
